summary: Certain hospitals can get discounted prescription drugs under the 340B Program. For example, nonprofit hospitals may qualify if they contract with state or local governments to provide services to low-income individuals who can’t get Medicaid or Medicare coverage. We found weaknesses in the Health Resources and Services Administration’s (HRSA) oversight that may result in some hospitals receiving discounts for which they are not eligible. We...
title: 340B Drug Discount Program: Increased Oversight Needed to Ensure Nongovernmental Hospitals Meet Eligibility Requirements
